source.title: Snap frozen (liquid N2) sample preparation and sectioning

source.description: Tissues will be cut to generate adjacent slides that are alternatively subjected to histological staining or MALDI-MSI. This sandwich like assignment allows proper orientation and localization of each MALDI-MSI ion image to its histological counterpart.

source.title: Snap frozen (liquid N2) sample preparation and sectioning

source.description: ITO slides with mounted coss-sections are then transferred directly from the cryostat to either the vacuum desiccator OR zipper bag.

source.title: Snap frozen (liquid N2) sample preparation and sectioning

source.description:
For imaging later: Place ITO slides in a zipper bag to keep vacuum inside of the bag for storing in the
freezer (sectioned samples can be stored in the freezer for months but should be analyzed as soon as possible). When removing the bag from the freezer, keep it close for ~5 minutes to reach RT before opening it.

source.title: Snap frozen (liquid N2) sample preparation and sectioning

source.description: For the 15T Fourier Transform Ion Cyclotron Resonance (FTICR) Mass Spectrometry, MALDI imaging slides are mounted in the Bruker MTP Slide Adapter II and scanned with a flatbed scanner with at least 3200 dpi resolution (output JPEG, TIFF, or PNG).

source.body: This is performed so that the optical image can be co-registered with the imaging experiment run. Visible fiducials (e.g., "X" marks) are previously placed onto MTP Slide Adapter to use as teaching points to register the optical and MS images.

source.title: Matrix application for MALDI-MSI: Start-up

source.description: Turn on TM-Sprayer unit. Set valve to LOAD position.

source.title: Matrix application for MALDI-MSI: Start-up

source.description: Launch TM-Sprayer Software

source.body: IMPORTANT: Check that exhaust fan is operational. Do not start solvent pump if proper active venting is not functioning.

source.title: Matrix application for MALDI-MSI: Start-up

source.description: Start solvent pump at 0.100 mL/min. Backpressure should be normal. ~ 500 psi (3.4 MPa)

source.title: Matrix application for MALDI-MSI: Start-up

source.description: Start compressed air flow to TM-Sprayer. Set at 10 psi (70 kPA).

source.title: Matrix application for MALDI-MSI: Start-up

source.description: Adjust operating temperature on the sprayer device per solvent mixture.

source.body: Follow safety instructions. SOLVENT MIXTURE SHOULD CONTAIN 30% WATER MINIMUM.

source.title: Matrix application for MALDI-MSI: Start-up

source.description: Prepare matrix solution. Typical concentration is

source.body:
Positive ion mode:
DHB is used at in 1:1 MeOH:Water; ; 3mm/track spacing; 8 cycles; 1200 mm/min spraying velocity; 0.05 mL/min matrix flow
DAN is used at in of 1:1 Ethanol:Water (Add of 1M HCl in milli'Q' water and of ethanol); ; 3 mm/track spacing; 16 cycles; 1250 mm/min spraying velocity; 0.05 mL/min matrix flow

Negative ion mode
NEDC is used at in 7:3 Methanol:Water; ; 3 mm/track spacing; 8 passes; 1200 mm/min spraying velocity; 0.12 mL/min matrix flow
DAN is used at in of 1:1 Ethanol:Water (Add of 1M HCl in milli'Q' water and of ethanol); ; 3 mm/track spacing; 16 cycles; 1250 mm/min spraying velocity; 0.05 mL/min matrix flow.
NOTE: These are, for now, the optimal condition for matric spraying based on METASPACE output and spatial resolution achieved, and we will continue to optimize both matrix applications.

source.title: Matrix application for MALDI-MSI: Start-up

source.description: With valve in LOAD position, use a syringe to fill loop with matrix.

source.body: 20% overfill is recommended (e.g. Use 6 mL syringe to fill 5 mL loop)

source.title: Matrix application for MALDI-MSI: Pause Mode

source.description: At the end of sample prep sequence, swith the valve back to LOAD.

source.body: IMPORTANT: Keep solvent pump flow on so that clean solvent flows to nozzle and prevents matrix residues from crystallizing and clogging the capillary and spray nozzle.

, then at 0.010 mL/min until ready to resume.

source.description: Carefully remove the upper aqueous metabolite layer until the interphase contracts without disturbing the protein disk, and discard.

source.title: Lipid extraction for LC-MS/MS

source.description: Carefully puncture the protein interphase with a pipette tip, remove the organic lipid phase from the bottom of the tube into a conical bottom Waters autosampler vial.

source.body: Be sure to gently push out any protein or upper methanol phase that might have entered the pipette tip.

materials.name: Parafilm™ M Laboratory Wrapping Film, 4 in. W x 125 ft. L; (10cm x 38m)
CryoStar NX50 Cryostat with height adjustment, Vacutome, Cold D, 100V
Conductive ITO Coating Glass Slides for MALDI Imaging
Wild type adult mouse kidneys (avg 200mg/kidney 12 kidneys >2g total)
2 mL screw cap vials (1 per layer of the mimetic model)
2 mL Sorenson MµlTI™ SafeSeal™ Microcentrifuge Tubes

description: Mass spectrometry imaging (MSI) is a cutting-edge molecular technology that enables simultaneous analysis of multiple molecular components directly from single cells, tissues, and organs. For MSI, cryosections are prepared from flash-frozen tissue and mounted on a contuctive glass slide. We use matrix-assisted laser desorption ionization (MALDI)-MSI, where tissue sections are coated with a MALDI matrix in order to facilitate laser ionization and detection of metabolites with mass spectrometry. We do it using an automated robotic sprayer (TM-Sprayer) with 2,5- dihydroxybenzoic acid (DHB) MALDI matrix for positive ion mode analysis, N-(1-naphthyl) ethylenediamine hydrochloride (NEDC) for negative ion mode analyses, or 1,5-Diaminonaphthalene (DAN) for dual-polarity analysis, prior to being loaded into the MALDI-Q Exactive HF-X Orbitrap-MSI or MALDI-FTICR-MSI for untargeted metabolomics analysis. We have optimized a method for matrix application to maximize analyte extraction from tissue and increase MALDI sensitivity and to create the most homogenous matrix films possible for best lateral resolution of lipids. A key capacity that will be critical for scale-up in KPMP is the use of a TM-sprayer robotic sprayer for MALDI matrix application. This will make inter-lab studies viable, by increasing the reproducibility of sample preparation and is currently in use at UTHSA and PNNL. Our lipid extraction protocol for LC-MS/MS is a robust and universal protocol for single-sample integrative proteomics, metabolomics, and lipidomics analyses (see citation).
